The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.\n\nThe app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. response_text: Here are solid software/tools that can give you live subtitles in the same language + a separate translated line during calls/meetings:  ✅ Built-in & Platform-Level Options  Zoom AI Companion – auto captions + auto translation into many languages in real time. Works inside Zoom meetings. Zoom [https://www.zoom.com/en/products/ai-assistant/features/accessibility/]  Google Meet Translated Captions – built-in live captions with optional translated captions toggled in settings. Google Help [https://support.google.com/meet/answer/10964115?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en]  ✅ Third-Party Tools with Live Transcription + Translation  Wordly – real-time AI captions, transcripts, and translated subtitles for Zoom, Teams, Google Meet, Webex, etc. Wordly+1 [https://www.wordly.ai/]  JotMe – live AI transcription and real-time translation alongside captions across numerous languages. JotMe [https://www.jotme.io/]  Talo – AI interpreter that works with Zoom/Teams/Google Meet for real-time speech translation + captions. Talo [https://taloai.com/]  Transync AI – live meeting translation with subtitles and voice translation usable across major platforms. 同言翻译 [https://www.transyncai.com/tools/live-meeting-translation/]  Interprefy / KUDO – enterprise-grade live translation + captioning with options for human interpreters. Interprefy+1 [https://www.interprefy.com/]  Felo Subtitles (Chrome extension) – adds live subtitles and can support multiple language lines in browser-based calls. chromewebstore.google.com [https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/felo-subtitles-chatgpt-li/ponokiofkijoolhebggofhhibnafebna?hl=en]  Notes & Tips  Otter.ai gives excellent live transcription but doesn’t translate in real time (translation is after the fact). lifewire.com [https://www.lifewire.com/otter-ai-french-spanish-transcriptions-8732706]  Some tools integrate directly as a bot or overlay captions on your screen, some require extensions/apps.  Want recommendations tailored to specific platforms (Zoom vs Teams vs Google Meet)?
